body.p: The Board noted that recognising unvested past service cost immediately results in the same accounting for past service cost and curtailments. As a result, the amendments made in 2011 revised the definitions of plan amendments and curtailments. Before those amendments, IAS 19 defined the curtailment of a plan as follows:

lq.p: A curtailment occurs when an entity either:

li.p: is demonstrably committed to make a significant reduction in the number of employees covered by a plan; or
amends the terms of a defined benefit plan so that a significant element of future service by current employees will no longer qualify for benefits, or will qualify only for reduced benefits.
